item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://mtssolicitors.com.au.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Home Page Description
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
Welcome

MTS Solicitors

MTS Solicitors is a well established legal firm providing professional and affordable conveyancing services. We are able to accommodate the needs of clients throughout Sydney. We provide a wide range of legal services based on the needs of each individual client. Our good name and reputation has been built on our reliability, customer service and flexibility. We pride ourselves on the quality of our legal expertise and local knowledge in providing our legal advice.

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
Rodney Razeen is the principal solicitor of the firm with over 25 years of legal experience. He specialises in property law, with a particular emphasis on conveyancing matters. He also focuses on Wills, Probate & Administration of Estates.

MTS Solicitors prides itself on its client relationship, based on mutual trust and understanding. We understand that communication is the key to this relationship and we ensure that the client is informed throughout all stages of the matter. We can guarantee our clients the highest level of privacy and confidentiality.

MTS Solicitors are first and foremost focused on matters concerning the client.

item.title: Buying a Business? What to Consider?
item.dc:creator: mtsuxr
item.content:encoded:
Buying a business is one of many strategies and choices an investor can consider and make when investing. It can be an exciting investment opportunity. However, among the excitement it is essential to ensure that your interests are protected in the transaction. So, it is important to know what to expect.Do your research thorough and well.  This process is known as due diligence. At this stage you will be going through the financial statements of the business with your accountant and the financial advisor, interviewing employees and engaging a lawyer to review the contracts of the business. Below are guidelines for you to assit with your due diligence
  1. -Why the business is being sold
  1. -Financial statements, tax records and PayG
  1. -Customer database
  1. -Suppliers
  1. -Conditions of assets and stocks
  1. -Obtain a copy of the development approval for the business from local council.
  1. -Any government regulations that you need to comply with
  1. -Any Council approvals and/or licences required
  1. -Obligations required by Fair Work in regards to employee leave entitlements, compulsory superannuation payments, long service leave
  1. -View Employment contracts If particular skills or experience required by staff
  1. -If the business heavily depends on the involvement of key personnel, you should consider asking those employees to stay on after the sale has been completed.
  1. -Insist on a training period with the seller to share knowledge about all the tasks necessary to operate the business successfully.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Buying a business is a huge decision that will impact your life and livelihood for many years to come. Therefore, ensure you are making a good investement.

item.title: MTS COVID-19 Message
item.dc:creator: mtsuxr
item.content:encoded: Our promise to you, in these uncertain times. The COVID-19 outbreak is impacting everyone around the world and every aspect of our daily lives: how we work, our communities, our family life and plans that we had set in motion for the year. Understandably, many of you will be concerned about what's ahead, how to proceed with your settlement or exchange of contract and what the impact of this outbreak means for the market and most importantly, for your future plans. As the situation continues to unfold, our promise to you is that we will continue our services as per usual, while abiding by precautionary measures set by the government. We are unwavering in our efforts to help you secure your dream home, so that you have can have a little peace of mind in such trying times. As we are committed to delivering a safe and reliable conveyancing experience for you, we are happy to offer various ways to communicate remotely via online platforms that you prefer, so as to minimise risk from physical meetings. Agents are also embracing new ways to connect sellers with buyers while practicing social distancing. As the global coronavirus outbreak continues to evolve, we are doing everything we can to take care of you in the best possible way. If you have any other doubts or questions, feel free to reach out to us. Stay safe and remember, we're all in this together.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: We are doing all we can to keep things moving. We assure that we are committed to deliver a safe, efficient and reliable conveyancing experience for you.
Dealing With Property While Social Distancing | MTS Solicitors

item.title: Can I move houses?
item.dc:creator: mtsuxr
item.content:encoded: We understand that most of you are now wondering if you can do your final inspection or move to your much awaited new home. Please see the latest update below. Extract from preview.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/public-health-orders You must stay at home unless you are going to -work (where you can’t work remotely) -school or an educational institution -shop for food and essentials -get medical care or supplies -exercise You may only leave home with a reasonable excuse, including to -move to a new place of residence, or between your different places of residence -avoid injury or illness or escape a risk of harm -deal with emergencies or on compassionate grounds -access childcare -provide care or assistance (including personal care) to a vulnerable person or to provide emergency assistance -attend a wedding or funeral (subject to 5 and 10 person limits) -donate blood -undertake legal obligations -access social services, employment services, services provided to victims (including as victims of crime), domestic violence services, and mental health services -continue existing arrangements for access to, and contact between, parents and children for children who do not live in   the same household as their parents or one of their parents -go to a place of worship or to provide pastoral care if you are a priest, minister of religion or member of a religious order.   Penalties for breaching orders Breach of orders made under the Public Health Act 2010 is a criminal offence and attracts heavy penalties. In the case of an individual, the maximum penalty is $11,000, or imprisonment for 6 months, or both and a further $5500 penalty may apply for each day the offence continues. The NSW Police may also issue on-the-spot fines of $1000 for an offence. In the case of any corporation, the maximum penalty is $55,000 and a further $27,500 penalty may apply for each day the offence continues.

item.title: Conveyancing & Property Law
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
We specialise in conveyancing in New South Wales We are committed to provide excellent services at a reasonable price The purchase of a home is the single biggest financial commitment most individuals will encounter in their lifetime. MTS Solicitors provides effective advice before, during and after the conveyancing process. We will safeguard your interests in the purchasing or selling

We offer professional advice in the following areas:

  • Preparation of contracts for sale of land for residential properties
  • Contract review for purchase of residential properties
  • Auction enquirers
  • Mortgages, refinancing & property deposit bonds
  • Caveats

item.title: Wills, Probate and Power of Attorney
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
Helping You Plan for the Future
We are highly trained and specialised in the preparation of wills and probates

  • Drafting, updating and contesting wills
  • Applying for Probate
  • Estate planning administration
  • Letters of Administration (in the event that a will is deemed invalid)
  • Drafting Enduring Power of Attorney and Enduring guardianship

Last Will

Having a valid will is important in that it ensures that your property is distributed in accordance with your wishes. You will be able to choose the guardian of your children; your executor and you can ensure that your estate will be settled easily and quickly.

Power of Attorney

There are two types of power of attorney

  • General power of attorney
  • Enduring power of attorney

A general power of attorney is given to someone to make financial decisions on your behalf when you are absent, for example, if you are overseas and need someone else to sell your house or pay your bills.

An enduring power of attorney is put in place in the event something happens to you (usually illness or accident) that makes you unable to make your own decisions

Enduring Guardianship

One way of planning for your own future is to appoint an enduring guardian. If you lose the capacity to make your own decisions, an enduring guardian can make personal decisions on your behalf, such as where you should live and what medical treatment and services you should receive

item.title: Commercial and Business Law
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
We are a dependable source of legal expertise for businesses of all types

MTS Solicitors specialise in commercial property transfers and related matters. We possess a considerable depth of knowledge and expertise in dealing with a wide range of commercial transactions.

The following gives an idea of the diversity of commercial work we carry out:

  • Formation, purchase and sale of business.
  • Purchase of Franchises
  • Drafting commercial agreements
  • Commercial & Retail Leases
  • Commercial Property Conveyancing

item.title: Notary Public
item.dc:creator: kosala
item.content:encoded:
Notary Public Services in NSW

In Australia, Notaries are senior legal practitioners who are qualified to authenticate, prepare, attest, verify, witness and certify original and copy documents for use in Australia and internationally. Notaries are also called as Notary Public or Public Notary.

As a Notary Public, we have the authority to attest and certify documents for use overseas, including but not limited to;

  • Powers of Attorney
  • Contracts
  • Wills
  • Deeds
  • Oaths
  • Statutory Declarations
  • Affidavits
  • Certify Copies Certification of personal documents (passports, bank statements);
  • International estate execution;
  • Purchase/sale of overseas real estate;
  • Identity verifications for overseas education and vocational institutions;
  • Verification of qualifications and personal particulars for overseas employment;
  • Consent to travel Letters;
  • Court orders & legal proceedings.

The Process

All services are offered by appointment. Please call or email us a rodney@mtssolicitors.com.au to book an appointment.

If you are unable to determine the cost of your document, please send us a message requesting a quote here or call us.

We are also able to facilitate the issuing of an Apostilles or Authentication at the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade and legalisation at various Embassies and/or Consulates.

Appointment

All services are offered by appointment. Please bring the below documents to the appointment:

  • The documents you require witnessed or certified with the originals.
  • All parties that the signature is requires need to be present
  • Passport, Drivers licence or photo card
  • Please do not sign the documents
  • Any change of name documents

Please see fee scale page for charges relating to recommended notary fees.

item.title: Buying a Business? What to consider?
item.dc:creator: mtsuxr
item.content:encoded:
1.    Why the business is being sold

2.    Financial statements, tax records and PayG

3.    Customer database

4.    Suppliers

5.    Conditions of assets and stocks

6.    Obtain a copy of the development approval for the business from local council.

7.    Any government regulations that you need to comply with

  1. Any Council approvals and/or licences required

9.    Obligations required by Fair Work in regards to employee leave entitlements, compulsory superannuation payments, long service leave

10.   View Employment contracts

11.   If particular skills or experience required by staff
